summary: Treasury's Fiscal Service issues debt to borrow money for federal operations, and reports the debt on financial statements called the Schedules of Federal Debt. As of Sept. 30, 2022, the federal debt was $30.9 trillion—up $2.5 trillion from FY 2021, and interest on the debt was $724 billion, an increase of $149 billion from FY 2021. We audit and issue opinions annually on the Schedules...
title: Financial Audit: Bureau of the Fiscal Service's FY 2022 and FY 2021 Schedules of Federal Debt
topics: Consolidated Financial Statements of the U.S. Government
